013package org.apache.juneau.cp;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
019import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
020
021import java.lang.annotation.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.concurrent.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025import java.util.stream.*;
026
027import org.apache.juneau.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.marshaller.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
033
034/**
035 * Java bean store.
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * A simple storage database for beans keyed by type and name.
039 * Used to retrieve and instantiate beans using an injection-like API.
040 * It's similar in concept to the injection framework of Spring but greatly simplified in function and not intended to implement a full-fledged injection framework.
041 *
042 * <p>
043 * Beans can be stored with or without names.  Named beans are typically resolved using
044 * the <ja>@Named</ja> or <ja>@Qualified</ja> annotations on constructor or method parameters.
045 *
046 * <p>
047 * Beans are added through the following methods:
048 * <ul class='javatreec'>
049 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #add(Class,Object) add(Class,Object)}
050 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #add(Class,Object,String) add(Class,Object,String)}
051 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addBean(Class,Object) addBean(Class,Object)}
052 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addBean(Class,Object,String) addBean(Class,Object,String)}
053 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addSupplier(Class,Supplier) addSupplier(Class,Supplier)}
054 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #addSupplier(Class,Supplier,String) addSupplier(Class,Supplier,String)}
055 * </ul>
056 *
057 * <p>
058 * Beans are retrieved through the following methods:
059 * <ul class='javatreec'>
060 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #getBean(Class) getBean(Class)}
061 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #getBean(Class,String) getBean(Class,String)}
062 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #stream(Class) stream(Class)}
063 * </ul>
064 *
065 * <p>
066 * Beans are created through the following methods:
067 * <ul class='javatreec'>
068 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createBean(Class) createBean(Class)}
069 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class) createMethodFinder(Class)}
070 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Class) createMethodFinder(Class,Class)}
071 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Object) createMethodFinder(Class,Object)}
072 * </ul>
073 *
074 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
075 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be nested using {@link Builder#parent(BeanStore)}.
076 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be made read-only using {@link Builder#readOnly()}.
077 *    <li class='note'>Bean stores can be made thread-safe using {@link Builder#threadSafe()}.
078 * </ul>
079 *
080 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
081 * </ul>
082 */
083public class BeanStore {
084
085   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
086   // Static
087   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
088
089   /**
090    * Non-existent bean store.
091    */
092   public static final class Void extends BeanStore {}
093
094   /**
095    * Static read-only reusable instance.
096    */
097   public static final BeanStore INSTANCE = create().readOnly().build();
098
099   /**
100    * Static creator.
101    *
102    * @return A new {@link Builder} object.
103    */
104   public static Builder create() {
105      return new Builder();
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Static creator.
110    *
111    * @param parent Parent bean store.  Can be <jk>null</jk> if this is the root resource.
112    * @return A new {@link BeanStore} object.
113    */
114   public static BeanStore of(BeanStore parent) {
115      return create().parent(parent).build();
116   }
117
118   /**
119    * Static creator.
120    *
121    * @param parent Parent bean store.  Can be <jk>null</jk> if this is the root resource.
122    * @param outer The outer bean used when instantiating inner classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
123    * @return A new {@link BeanStore} object.
124    */
125   public static BeanStore of(BeanStore parent, Object outer) {
126      return create().parent(parent).outer(outer).build();
127   }
128
129   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
130   // Builder
131   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
132
133   /**
134    * Builder class.
135    */
136   @FluentSetters
137   public static class Builder {
138
139      BeanStore parent;
140      boolean readOnly, threadSafe;
141      Object outer;
142      Class<? extends BeanStore> type;
143      BeanStore impl;
144
145      /**
146       * Constructor.
147       */
148      protected Builder() {}
149
150      /**
151       * Instantiates this bean store.
152       *
153       * @return A new bean store.
154       */
155      public BeanStore build() {
156         if (impl != null)
157            return impl;
158         if (type == null || type == BeanStore.class)
159            return new BeanStore(this);
160
161         ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(type);
162
163         MethodInfo m = c.getDeclaredMethod(
164            x -> x.isPublic()
165            && x.hasNoParams()
166            && x.isStatic()
167            && x.hasName("getInstance")
168         );
169         if (m != null)
170            return m.invoke(null);
171
172         ConstructorInfo ci = c.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.canAccept(this));
173         if (ci != null)
174            return ci.invoke(this);
175
176         ci = c.getDeclaredConstructor(x -> x.isProtected() && x.canAccept(this));
177         if (ci != null)
178            return ci.accessible().invoke(this);
179
180         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Could not find a way to instantiate class {0}", type);
181      }
182
183      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
184      // Properties
185      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
186
187      /**
188       * Specifies the parent bean store.
189       *
190       * <p>
191       * Bean searches are performed recursively up this parent chain.
192       *
193       * @param value The setting value.
194       * @return  This object.
195       */
196      @FluentSetter
197      public Builder parent(BeanStore value) {
198         parent = value;
199         return this;
200      }
201
202      /**
203       * Specifies that the bean store is read-only.
204       *
205       * <p>
206       * This means methods such as {@link BeanStore#addBean(Class, Object)} cannot be used.
207       *
208       * @return  This object.
209       */
210      @FluentSetter
211      public Builder readOnly() {
212         readOnly = true;
213         return this;
214      }
215
216      /**
217       * Specifies that the bean store being created should be thread-safe.
218       *
219       * @return  This object.
220       */
221      @FluentSetter
222      public Builder threadSafe() {
223         threadSafe = true;
224         return this;
225      }
226
227      /**
228       * Specifies the outer bean context.
229       *
230       * <p>
231       * The outer context bean to use when calling constructors on inner classes.
232       *
233       * @param value The outer bean context.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
234       * @return  This object.
235       */
236      @FluentSetter
237      public Builder outer(Object value) {
238         this.outer = value;
239         return this;
240      }
241
242      /**
243       * Overrides the bean to return from the {@link #build()} method.
244       *
245       * @param value The bean to return from the {@link #build()} method.
246       * @return This object.
247       */
248      @FluentSetter
249      public Builder impl(BeanStore value) {
250         this.impl = value;
251         return this;
252      }
253
254      /**
255       * Overrides the bean store type.
256       *
257       * <p>
258       * The specified type must have one of the following:
259       * <ul>
260       *    <li>A static <c>getInstance()</c> method.
261       *    <li>A public constructor that takes in this builder.
262       *    <li>A protected constructor that takes in this builder.
263       * </ul>
264       *
265       * @param value The bean store type.
266       * @return This object.
267       */
268      @FluentSetter
269      public Builder type(Class<? extends BeanStore> value) {
270         this.type = value;
271         return this;
272      }
273   }
274
275   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
276   // Instance
277   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
278
279   private final Deque<BeanStoreEntry<?>> entries;
280   private final Map<Class<?>,BeanStoreEntry<?>> unnamedEntries;
281
282   final Optional<BeanStore> parent;
283   final Optional<Object> outer;
284   final boolean readOnly, threadSafe;
285   final SimpleReadWriteLock lock;
286
287   BeanStore() {
288      this(create());
289   }
290
291   /**
292    * Constructor.
293    *
294    * @param builder The builder containing the settings for this bean.
295    */
296   protected BeanStore(Builder builder) {
297      parent = Utils.opt(builder.parent);
298      outer = Utils.opt(builder.outer);
299      readOnly = builder.readOnly;
300      threadSafe = builder.threadSafe;
301      lock = threadSafe ? new SimpleReadWriteLock() : SimpleReadWriteLock.NO_OP;
302      entries = threadSafe ? new ConcurrentLinkedDeque<>() : new LinkedList<>();
303      unnamedEntries = threadSafe ? new ConcurrentHashMap<>() : map();
304   }
305
306   /**
307    * Adds an unnamed bean of the specified type to this factory.
308    *
309    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
310    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
311    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
312    * @return This object.
313    */
314   public <T> BeanStore addBean(Class<T> beanType, T bean) {
315      return addBean(beanType, bean, null);
316   }
317
318   /**
319    * Adds a named bean of the specified type to this factory.
320    *
321    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
322    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
323    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
324    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
325    * @return This object.
326    */
327   public <T> BeanStore addBean(Class<T> beanType, T bean, String name) {
328      return addSupplier(beanType, ()->bean, name);
329   }
330
331   /**
332    * Adds a supplier for an unnamed bean of the specified type to this factory.
333    *
334    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
335    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
336    * @param bean The bean supplier.
337    * @return This object.
338    */
339   public <T> BeanStore addSupplier(Class<T> beanType, Supplier<T> bean) {
340      return addSupplier(beanType, bean, null);
341   }
342
343   /**
344    * Adds a supplier for a named bean of the specified type to this factory.
345    *
346    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
347    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
348    * @param bean The bean supplier.
349    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
350    * @return This object.
351    */
352   public <T> BeanStore addSupplier(Class<T> beanType, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
353      assertCanWrite();
354      BeanStoreEntry<T> e = createEntry(beanType, bean, name);
355      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
356         entries.addFirst(e);
357         if (Utils.isEmpty(name))
358            unnamedEntries.put(beanType, e);
359      }
360      return this;
361   }
362
363   /**
364    * Same as {@link #addBean(Class,Object)} but returns the bean instead of this object for fluent calls.
365    *
366    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
367    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
368    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
369    * @return The bean.
370    */
371   public <T> T add(Class<T> beanType, T bean) {
372      add(beanType, bean, null);
373      return bean;
374   }
375
376   /**
377    * Same as {@link #addBean(Class,Object,String)} but returns the bean instead of this object for fluent calls.
378    *
379    * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
380    * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
381    * @param bean The bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
382    * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
383    * @return The bean.
384    */
385   public <T> T add(Class<T> beanType, T bean, String name) {
386      addBean(beanType, bean, name);
387      return bean;
388   }
389
390   /**
391    * Clears out all bean in this bean store.
392    *
393    * <p>
394    * Does not affect the parent bean store.
395    *
396    * @return This object.
397    */
398   public BeanStore clear() {
399      assertCanWrite();
400      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
401         unnamedEntries.clear();
402         entries.clear();
403      }
404      return this;
405   }
406
407   /**
408    * Returns the unnamed bean of the specified type.
409    *
410    * @param <T> The type of bean to return.
411    * @param beanType The type of bean to return.
412    * @return The bean.
413    */
414   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
415   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> beanType) {
416      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {
417         BeanStoreEntry<T> e = (BeanStoreEntry<T>) unnamedEntries.get(beanType);
418         if (e != null)
419            return Utils.opt(e.get());
420         if (parent.isPresent())
421            return parent.get().getBean(beanType);
422         return Utils.opte();
423      }
424   }
425
426   /**
427    * Returns the named bean of the specified type.
428    *
429    * @param <T> The type of bean to return.
430    * @param beanType The type of bean to return.
431    * @param name The bean name.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
432    * @return The bean.
433    */
434   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
435   public <T> Optional<T> getBean(Class<T> beanType, String name)  {
436      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {
437         BeanStoreEntry<T> e = (BeanStoreEntry<T>)entries.stream().filter(x2 -> x2.matches(beanType, name)).findFirst().orElse(null);
438         if (e != null)
439            return Utils.opt(e.get());
440         if (parent.isPresent())
441            return parent.get().getBean(beanType, name);
442         return Utils.opte();
443      }
444   }
445
446   /**
447    * Returns all the beans in this store of the specified type.
448    *
449    * <p>
450    * Returns both named and unnamed beans.
451    *
452    * <p>
453    * The results from the parent bean store are appended to the list of beans from this beans store.
454    *
455    * @param <T> The bean type to return.
456    * @param beanType The bean type to return.
457    * @return The bean entries.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
458    */
459   public <T> Stream<BeanStoreEntry<T>> stream(Class<T> beanType)  {
460      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
461      Stream<BeanStoreEntry<T>> s = entries.stream().filter(x -> x.matches(beanType)).map(x -> (BeanStoreEntry<T>)x);
462      if (parent.isPresent())
463         s = Stream.concat(s, parent.get().stream(beanType));
464      return s;
465   }
466
467   /**
468    * Removes an unnamed bean from this store.
469    *
470    * @param beanType The bean type being removed.
471    * @return This object.
472    */
473   public BeanStore removeBean(Class<?> beanType) {
474      return removeBean(beanType, null);
475   }
476
477   /**
478    * Removes a named bean from this store.
479    *
480    * @param beanType The bean type being removed.
481    * @param name The bean name to remove.
482    * @return This object.
483    */
484   public BeanStore removeBean(Class<?> beanType, String name) {
485      assertCanWrite();
486      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
487         if (name == null)
488            unnamedEntries.remove(beanType);
489         entries.removeIf(y -> y.matches(beanType, name));
490      }
491      return this;
492   }
493
494   /**
495    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified unnamed bean type.
496    *
497    * @param beanType The bean type to check.
498    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified unnamed bean type.
499    */
500   public boolean hasBean(Class<?> beanType) {
501      return unnamedEntries.containsKey(beanType) || parent.map(x -> x.hasBean(beanType)).orElse(false);
502   }
503
504   /**
505    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified named bean type.
506    *
507    * @param beanType The bean type to check.
508    * @param name The bean name.
509    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this store contains the specified named bean type.
510    */
511   public boolean hasBean(Class<?> beanType, String name) {
512      return entries.stream().anyMatch(x -> x.matches(beanType, name)) || parent.map(x -> x.hasBean(beanType, name)).orElse(false);
513   }
514
515   /**
516    * Instantiates a bean creator.
517    *
518    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
519    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreator} for usage.
520    * </ul>
521    *
522    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
523    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
524    * @return A new bean creator.
525    */
526   public <T> BeanCreator<T> createBean(Class<T> beanType) {
527      return new BeanCreator<>(beanType, this);
528   }
529
530   /**
531    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
532    *
533    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
534    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
535    * </ul>
536    *
537    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
538    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
539    * @param resource The class containing the bean creator method.
540    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
541    */
542   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType, Object resource) {
543      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, resource, this);
544   }
545
546   /**
547    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
548    *
549    * <p>
550    * Same as {@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Class)} but looks for only static methods on the specified resource class
551    * and not also instance methods within the context of a bean.
552    *
553    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
554    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
555    * </ul>
556    *
557    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
558    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
559    * @param resourceClass The class containing the bean creator method.
560    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
561    */
562   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType, Class<?> resourceClass) {
563      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, resourceClass , this);
564   }
565
566   /**
567    * Create a method finder for finding bean creation methods.
568    *
569    * <p>
570    * Same as {@link #createMethodFinder(Class,Object)} but uses {@link Builder#outer(Object)} as the resource bean.
571    *
572    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
573    *    <li class='jc'>{@link BeanCreateMethodFinder} for usage.
574    * </ul>
575    *
576    * @param <T> The bean type to create.
577    * @param beanType The bean type to create.
578    * @return The method finder.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
579    */
580   public <T> BeanCreateMethodFinder<T> createMethodFinder(Class<T> beanType) {
581      return new BeanCreateMethodFinder<>(beanType, outer.orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Method cannot be used without outer bean definition.")), this);
582   }
583
584   /**
585    * Given an executable, returns a list of types that are missing from this factory.
586    *
587    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
588    * @return A comma-delimited list of types that are missing from this factory, or <jk>null</jk> if none are missing.
589    */
590   public String getMissingParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
591      List<ParamInfo> params = executable.getParams();
592      List<String> l = list();
593      loop: for (int i = 0; i < params.size(); i++) {
594         ParamInfo pi = params.get(i);
595         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
596         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get()))
597            continue loop;
598         if (pt.is(Optional.class) || pt.is(BeanStore.class))
599            continue loop;
600         String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
601         Class<?> ptc = pt.inner();
602         if (beanName == null && !hasBean(ptc))
603            l.add(pt.getSimpleName());
604         if (beanName != null && !hasBean(ptc, beanName))
605            l.add(pt.getSimpleName() + '@' + beanName);
606      }
607      return l.isEmpty() ? null : l.stream().sorted().collect(joining(","));
608   }
609
610   /**
611    * Given the list of param types, returns <jk>true</jk> if this factory has all the parameters for the specified executable.
612    *
613    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
614    * @return A comma-delimited list of types that are missing from this factory.
615    */
616   public boolean hasAllParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
617      loop: for (int i = 0; i < executable.getParamCount(); i++) {
618         ParamInfo pi = executable.getParam(i);
619         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
620         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get()))
621            continue loop;
622         if (pt.is(Optional.class) || pt.is(BeanStore.class))
623            continue loop;
624         String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
625         Class<?> ptc = pt.inner();
626         if ((beanName == null && !hasBean(ptc)) || (beanName != null && !hasBean(ptc, beanName)))
627            return false;
628      }
629      return true;
630   }
631
632
633   /**
634    * Returns the corresponding beans in this factory for the specified param types.
635    *
636    * @param executable The constructor or method to get the params for.
637    * @return The corresponding beans in this factory for the specified param types.
638    */
639   public Object[] getParams(ExecutableInfo executable) {
640      Object[] o = new Object[executable.getParamCount()];
641      for (int i = 0; i < executable.getParamCount(); i++) {
642         ParamInfo pi = executable.getParam(i);
643         ClassInfo pt = pi.getParameterType();
644         if (i == 0 && outer.isPresent() && pt.isInstance(outer.get())) {
645            o[i] = outer.get();
646         } else if (pt.is(BeanStore.class)) {
647            o[i] = this;
648         } else {
649            String beanName = findBeanName(pi);
650            Class<?> ptc = pt.unwrap(Optional.class).inner();
651            Optional<?> o2 = beanName == null ? getBean(ptc) : getBean(ptc, beanName);
652            o[i] = pt.is(Optional.class) ? o2 : o2.orElse(null);
653         }
654      }
655      return o;
656   }
657
658   @Override /* Object */
659   public String toString() {
660      return Json5.of(properties());
661   }
662
663   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
664   // Extension methods
665   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
666
667   /**
668    * Creates an entry in this store for the specified bean.
669    *
670    * <p>
671    * Subclasses can override this method to create their own entry subtypes.
672    *
673    * @param <T> The class type to associate with the bean.
674    * @param type The class type to associate with the bean.
675    * @param bean The bean supplier.
676    * @param name Optional name to associate with the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
677    * @return A new bean store entry.
678    */
679   protected <T> BeanStoreEntry<T> createEntry(Class<T> type, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
680      return BeanStoreEntry.create(type, bean, name);
681   }
682
683   // <FluentSetters>
684
685      // </FluentSetters>
686
687   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
688   // Helper methods
689   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
690   private String findBeanName(ParamInfo pi) {
691      Annotation n = pi.getAnnotation(Annotation.class, x -> x.annotationType().getSimpleName().equals("Named"));
692      if (n != null)
693         return AnnotationInfo.of((ClassInfo)null, n).getValue(String.class, "value", NOT_EMPTY).orElse(null);
694      return null;
695   }
696
697   private void assertCanWrite() {
698      if (readOnly)
699         throw new IllegalStateException("Method cannot be used because BeanStore is read-only.");
700   }
701
702   private JsonMap properties() {
703      Predicate<Boolean> nf = Utils::isTrue;
704      return filteredMap()
705         .append("identity", Utils2.identity(this))
706         .append("entries", entries.stream().map(BeanStoreEntry::properties).collect(toList()))
707         .append("outer", Utils2.identity(outer.orElse(null)))
708         .append("parent", parent.map(BeanStore::properties).orElse(null))
709         .appendIf(nf, "readOnly", readOnly)
710         .appendIf(nf, "threadSafe", threadSafe)
711      ;
712   }
713}
